de.weltraumschaf.commons.shell

Class DefaultScanner

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.weltraumschaf.commons.shell.DefaultScanner
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Scanner

     class DefaultScanner
extends Object
implements Scanner
    Default implementation for scanning the input line from an interactive shell.

    The scanner tokenizes:

    • alpha numeric literals
    • (signed) integer number literals
    • (signed) float number literals
    • boolean literals (true/false)
    • and single/double quote delimited string literals
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Sven Strittmatter

      • scanLiteral

        Recognize alpha numeric string tokens until next white space character.

      • scanLiteralOrKeyword

        private Token scanLiteralOrKeyword(CharacterStream characterStream,
                         StringBuilder value)
        Recognize alpha numeric string tokens until next white space character.
        Parameters:
        characterStream - input line to scan
        value - collects the token string, must not be null
        Returns:
        Return string type token

      • scanNumber

        private Token scanNumber(CharacterStream characterStream)
        Recognize numeric tokens until next white space character.

        If this method recognizes a dot it will try to scan a float. If any not number character is detected it will treat the token as a literal/keyword.

        Parameters:
        characterStream - input line to scan
        Returns:
        integer or float or literal or keyword type token

      • scanFloat

        private Token scanFloat(CharacterStream characterStream,
              StringBuilder value)
        Recognize float tokens until next white space character.

        If any not number character is detected it will treat the token as a literal/keyword.

        Parameters:
        characterStream - input line to scan
        value - accumulates the token literal string
        Returns:
        float or literal or keyword type token

      • scanString

        private Token scanString(CharacterStream characterStream)
                  throws SyntaxException
        Scan string tokens. String tokens are everything encapsulated in single or double quotes.
        Parameters:
        characterStream - input line to scan
        Returns:
        integer type token
        Throws:
        SyntaxException - if string is not correct encapsulated by quotes

      • isKeyword

        private boolean isKeyword(String token)
        Determines if a token string is a keyword. Checks the string against LiteralCommandMap.isCommand(java.lang.String) and LiteralCommandMap.isSubCommand(java.lang.String).
        Parameters:
        token - string to check
        Returns:
        true if given string is a keyword else false

      • isAllowedInFloat

        private boolean isAllowedInFloat(char c)
        Whether an character is allowed in float literals.

        Allowed are signs (+|-) and the exponential characters (E|e).

        Parameters:
        c - any character
        Returns:
        true if c is allowed, else false
